column4: would anyone know how on earth after i did and install, setup everything, and i rebooted after a while, only to find my ubuntu isntallation the same as if it were just installed with any of my files and programs i installed gone?>
i did a fakeraid install, worked fine, was using it for a while, then rebooted and its like i was never logged into my system
did you do stuff on the livecd then reboot or something?
the livecd does not write stuff to disk
no no, i did the install and booted to the hd

i did though at one point have to boot back to the livecd and fix something with grub after i made a partition change, but i had rebooted plenty of times befoer, then all of a sudden bam, i was back to liek i had a fresh install
odd, ive never heard of it before
its happened 2x, the first time i figured i just didnt set something up correct
not sure what to say..probably some type of bug
you think it would have anything to do with mounting the proc and sysfs while in the livecd
i followed the fakeraid howto install
ah yea chances are it's something in there.  but i dont know a whole lot about debian installs/chroot/etc
